issues.description: The UML in the problem statement specifies getTotalNumberOfStudents() as public (shown with '+'), and the exercise tasks imply it should be publicly accessible. In the solution implementation, getTotalNumberOfStudents() is declared protected. This visibility difference is a structural inconsistency: the method is less accessible in the solution than the specification/UML indicates. Students (and automated tests) expecting a public method may be confused or unable to call this method if they rely on the solution as reference.
issues.suggested_fix: Make getTotalNumberOfStudents() public to match the UML and the task description (change 'protected int getTotalNumberOfStudents()' to 'public int getTotalNumberOfStudents()'). Also ensure the template and any example signatures or comments indicate the method is public so students and tests have a consistent expectation.
